Author.description: Metadata to describe a single author or maintainer.

email.description: E-mail address for the author or team.
email.title: Email

name.description: Name of the author or team.
name.title: Name

Author.title: Author

config.description: Configuration details for the install tool.
config.title: Config

constraints.description:
Additional constraints to impose on the solver for conda dependencies.
These are not requirements, but will condition which packages are available for selection.
constraints.title: Constraints

dependencies.description: conda packages to install. It must be a mapping of package names to package versions. Use `*` for the version if any version works. The value can also be an object that specifies version, build and/or channel.
dependencies.title: Dependencies

pypi-dependencies.description: PyPI packages to install. It must be a mapping of package names to package versions. Use `*` for the version if any version works.
pypi-dependencies.title: Pypi-Dependencies

system-requirements.help:
Properties of system features.

These will be exposed to the solver for the appropriate
selection of package variants, usually as lower bounds.

Project.description: Metadata about for this manifest file. Mostly static.

authors.description: People or teams involved in the creation and maintenance of this file.
authors.title: Authors

description.description: An optional free-form text field for maintainers to document this manifest file. Supports Markdown.
description.title: Description

license.description: SPDX expression describing the license of this work.
license.title: License

license-files.description: List of paths to the license files governing this work.
license-files.title: License-Files

revision.description: A version-like string that allows maintainers to apply versioning schemes to this manifest file.
revision.title: Revision

urls.description: Mapping of website names to their URL addresses.
urls.title: Urls

Project.title: Project

SystemRequirements.description:
Properties of system features.
These will be exposed to the solver for the appropriate selection of package variants, usually as lower bounds.

archspec.description: System architecture name. Equivalent to setting `CONDA_OVERRIDE_ARCHSPEC`.
archspec.title: Archspec

cuda.description: Version of CUDA. Equivalent to setting `CONDA_OVERRIDE_CUDA`.
cuda.title: Cuda

libc.description: Version of the system libc (Linux only). Equivalent to setting `CONDA_OVERRIDE_GLIBC`.
libc.title: Libc

linux.description: Version of the Linux kernel. Equivalent to setting `CONDA_OVERRIDE_LINUX`.
linux.title: Linux

osx.description: Version of macOS. Equivalent to setting `CONDA_OVERRIDE_OSX`.
osx.title: Osx

win.description: Version of Windows in use. Equivalent to setting `CONDA_OVERRIDE_WIN`.
win.title: Win

SystemRequirements.title: SystemRequirements

$schema.description: JSON Schema URL or path used to validate this input file.
$schema.title: $Schema

about.help: Metadata about for this manifest file. Mostly static.

config.description: Configuration details for the install tool.
config.title: Config

constraints.description:
Additional constraints to impose on the solver for conda dependencies.
These are not requirements, but will condition which packages are available for selection.
constraints.title: Constraints

dependencies.description: conda packages to install. It must be a mapping of package names to package versions. Use `*` for the version if any version works. The value can also be an object that specifies version, build and/or channel.
dependencies.title: Dependencies

pypi-dependencies.description: PyPI packages to install. It must be a mapping of package names to package versions. Use `*` for the version if any version works.
pypi-dependencies.title: Pypi-Dependencies

system-requirements.help:
Properties of system features.

These will be exposed to the solver for the appropriate
selection of package variants, usually as lower bounds.

version.description: Version of the conda.toml file format.
version.title: Version
